title: Suggest changing `_x` to `x` instead of a use of `x` to `_x`

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

body:
Variables can be marked as unused by prepending with an underscore. If at some point such a variable is used again, the compiler suggests to name the use `_x`, even though every single time I have encountered this, what I wanted is to change the definition of `_x` to `x`.

```rust
fn main() {
    let _x = 42;
    let y = x;
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=048e1ff416fb850e7da08c31373b4433))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0465]: multiple rlib candidates for `debug_unreachable` found
  |
  = note: candidate #1: /playground/target/debug/deps/libdebug_unreachable-aa3385f4476cae47.rlib
  = note: candidate #2: /playground/target/debug/deps/libdebug_unreachable-661505f3db863158.rlib

error[E0425]: cannot find value `x` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:3:13
  |
3 |     let y = x;
  |             ^ help: a local variable with a similar name exists: `_x`

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

Some errors occurred: E0425, E0465.
For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0425`.
error: Could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```
